page.title: 03SHELTON OAK COTTAGES.
page.content: Shelton Oak Cottages is a long row of cottages built in orange bricks. The first part was built in about 1750 and it was added to between 1800 and 1850. Some of the original walls were made of wattle and daub but they have since been plastered over. The bedroom floors are polished oak and many of them slope towards the doors. In the oldest cottage some of the walls are timber framed and there are two big inglenook fireplaces. The row of cottages was built on the site of an old manor home. Under the lawns a cobbled yard has been found. The soil is very good and everything grows well because it has been cultivated as a garden for a long time. Shelton probably means 'town on a shelf above the river'.
